parts.text: {"word":"docks","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"ドック、船渠（せんきょ）、埠頭（ふとう）","english_definition":"an enclosed area of water in a port for the loading, unloading, building, and repairing of ships.","examples":[{"sentence":"The ship was being repaired in the docks.","translation":"その船はドックで修理されていた。"},{"sentence":"We watched the cargo being unloaded at the docks.","translation":"私たちは埠頭で貨物が積み降ろされるのを見ていた。"},{"sentence":"The docks were busy with activity.","translation":"ドックは活気に満ちていた。"}],"collocations":["at the docks (ドックで)","in the docks (ドックで)","the London docks (ロンドンのドック)","ship docks (船のドック)","dry docks (乾ドック)"],"synonyms":["harbor","port","wharf","quay","marina"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"入港する、ドックに入る","english_definition":"(of a ship) to enter a dock.","examples":[{"sentence":"The ship docked at 6 a.m.","translation":"その船は午前6時に入港した。"},{"sentence":"The ferry docks every hour.","translation":"フェリーは毎時間ドックに入る。"}],"collocations":["dock at (～にドック入りする)","dock in (～にドック入りする)"],"synonyms":["moor","berth","anchor","tie up"],"antonyms":["undock","set sail","depart"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"ドックに入れる、停泊させる","english_definition":"to bring a ship into a dock.","examples":[{"sentence":"They docked the ship for repairs.","translation":"彼らは修理のために船をドックに入れた。"},{"sentence":"The captain docked the boat skillfully.","translation":"船長は巧みにボートを停泊させた。"}],"collocations":["dock a ship (船をドックに入れる)","dock a boat (ボートをドックに入れる)"],"synonyms":["moor","berth","berth","tie up"],"antonyms":["undock","launch"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"（植物）ギシギシ","english_definition":"a plant of the genus Rumex, typically having long leaves and clusters of small greenish flowers.","examples":[{"sentence":"The field was full of docks and thistles.","translation":"その畑はギシギシとアザミでいっぱいだった。"}],"collocations":["broad-leaved dock (ヘラオオバギシギシ)","curled dock (ナガバギシギシ)"],"synonyms":["sorrel","Rumex"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"（給料など）を減らす、差し引く","english_definition":"to deduct (something, especially money) from someone's pay.","examples":[{"sentence":"They docked his pay for being late.","translation":"彼らは遅刻したため、彼の給料を減額した。"},{"sentence":"The company docked her wages for the mistake.","translation":"会社は彼女のミスのために賃金を差し引いた。"}],"collocations":["dock pay (給料を減らす)","dock wages (賃金を減らす)"],"synonyms":["deduct","subtract","reduce","decrease"],"antonyms":["increase","add","raise"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"（動物の尾）を短く切る","english_definition":"to cut short the tail of an animal, especially a horse or dog.","examples":[{"sentence":"They docked the dog's tail when it was a puppy.","translation":"彼らは子犬の頃にその犬の尾を短く切った。"}],"collocations":["dock a tail (尾を短く切る)"],"synonyms":["crop","shorten","truncate"],"antonyms":["lengthen"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Middle English 'dokke' (for the plant) and Middle Dutch 'docke' or Middle Low German 'docke' (for the enclosure). The 'deduct' sense comes from the idea of reducing something, as in shortening a tail.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/dɒks/","syllables":"docks"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"docks","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["dock","docks"],"past_simple":"docked","past_participle":"docked","present_participle":"docking"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Docks' can refer to the area of a port with facilities for ships, or specifically to the enclosed areas of water. As a verb, it means to bring a ship into a dock. It can also refer to deducting money from someone's pay or shortening an animal's tail. The plant 'dock' is a separate meaning.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"The ship was docked on the sea.","correct":"The ship was docked in the harbor. / The ship was at the docks.","note":"Ships are docked in harbors or at docks, not "on the sea.""},{"incorrect":"He was docked of his salary.","correct":"His salary was docked. / They docked his salary.","note":"The correct phrasing is 'his salary was docked' or 'they docked his salary' not 'docked of'."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["dockyard (造船所)","dockworker (港湾労働者)"],"phrasal_verbs":["dock with (宇宙船などがドッキングする)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B1","frequency_google_ngram":"Moderate","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"The word 'docks' has several meanings. The most common is a place where ships load and unload goods or are repaired. It can also be a verb meaning to bring a ship into a dock. Less commonly, it can refer to a type of plant or to deducting money from someone's pay. It's important to understand the context to know which meaning is intended."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The cargo ship arrived at the **docks** early this morning.","translation":"その貨物船は今朝早くドックに到着した。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"埠頭"},{"sentence":"The captain carefully **docked** the ship.","translation":"船長は慎重に船をドックに入れた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"入港させる"},{"sentence":"They **docked** his wages for the repeated tardiness.","translation":"彼らは度重なる遅刻のために彼の給料を減額した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"減らす"},{"sentence":"The field was overgrown with **docks**.","translation":"その畑はギシギシが生い茂っていた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"植物"}]}
